entries.femaleVariant: You folks been watchin' the news? Seems Roy Levack, CTO of Moore Technologies, caused his limo to crash into a school bus, killing 10 kids.
Levack was arrested on the spot and taken into custody where he'll await trial. He's likely to face up to forty years in prison.
Heh, just kidding. He's waaay too rich for that.
Nope, Roy hasn't been charged with anything. In fact, later that evening, he was at a charity event in city hall to raise money for the children harmed in the accident.
Again, kidding! Hahaha, God, so naive. It's like you people never even watch my show.
Honestly, who cares about some snotty-nosed brats? The fundraiser was run by Councilman Gonzalez's election committee.
But, but!... Roy did express his deepest sympathies for the victims' families.
Ah dammit, didn't fool y'all that time did I?
Of course that's not true. In fact, Levack claimed he'd sue anyone for mentioning the limo accident in public and--
Well, Roy, my boy... Looks like I'll be seeing you in court.
But y'know what? I got a big bank account too, and I love to see conceited pricks like you squirm.
Yeah, I may be rich, but what am I to a multibazillionaire like Roy?
When he sends me that "Cease and Desist" I'll have to drop my pants and apologize to the world. It's either that or be destroyed.
Night City doesn't have superheroes, folks. And I think I'll end today on that. G'night.
